title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Temple of Nuclear Waste," Front Side", ca. 1987
medium: Black and color marking pens, graphite, white and blue crayon (?) on white tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in black marking pen lower center, right:  "Temple of Nuclear Waste;" lower center, left:  7. [encircled]
description: Three panel screen on wheels in form of three abstract, highly decorative, colorful buildings.  Central skyscraper structure in orange with black dotes with red stepped pediment with two antane. Two identical structures on either side with green upper half and blue lower half with red scalloped decoration on outer edge. Yellow fan-shaped pediments on top. Triangular pattern on base.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Temple of Nuclear Waste," Front Side", ca. 1987.
ca. 1987. Black and color marking pens, graphite, white and blue crayon (?) on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-105.
